bibl.title: Letter from Hideyo Noguchi to Frederick F. Russell, September 20, 1923

div1.p: Noguchi is sending a report on liver sections from a suspected yellow fever patient.

div1.head: Letter from Hideyo Noguchi to Frederick F. Russell, September 20, 1923

opener.dateline:
Rockefeller Institute
for Medical Research
66 Street and Avenue A
New York City
September 20, 1923

div1.p:
I am enclosing the report of our findings
in the sections which Dr. Muller has stained from the
block of liver from the Corona case. The paraffin
sections will not change the diagnosis, and I do not
think it will be necessary to make any. Do you want
me to return the slides which you sent, or shall we
keep them here with ours?
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, (Signed) Hideyo Noguchi Dr. F. F. Russell
International Health Board
61 Broadway, New York, N.Y.
